greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of q* (psi(q^9)/phi(q^9))/ (psi(q)/phi(q)) in powers of q where psi(),phi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) := Prod_{k>=1} (1-(-q)^k) (see A121373), phi(q) := theta_3(q) := Sum_{k=-oo..oo} q^(k^2) (A000122), psi(q) := Sum_{k=0..oo} q^(k*(k+1)/2) (A010054), chi(q) := Prod_{k>=0} (1+q^(2k+1)) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of eta(q^2)^3* eta(q^9)* eta(q^36)^2/ (eta(q)* eta(q^4)^2* eta(q^18)^3) in powers of q.
G.f. A(x) satisfies 0=f(A(x), A(x^2)) where f(u, v)=v* (1-v+v^2)* (1-u^2)^2 -(1-u*v)^2* (u-v)^2.
mathematica: A128143[n_] := SeriesCoefficient[q*(QPochhammer[q^9]/QPochhammer[q])* (QPochhammer[q^36]/QPochhammer[q^4])^2*(QPochhammer[q^2]/QPochhammer[q^18])^3, {q, 0, n}]; Rest[Table[A128143[n], {n, 0, 1000}]] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 09 2017 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n)=local(A); if(n<1, 0, n--; A=x*O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^2+A)^3*eta(x^9+A)*eta(x^36+A)^2/ (eta(x+A)*eta(x^4+A)^2*eta(x^18+A)^3), n))}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Feb 16 2007
